result.title: Use case simulation methodology
result.description: Public report and open data repository delivered at the end of M33. The report will include the description of the methodology followed to perform the simulations needed for the assessment of the Use Cases, the data collected and the RAW results. The database will be published in an open-access database (ensuring full compliance with the FAIR principles) to be reused by the stakeholders and the research community. This deliverable will be peer reviewed by scientific experts.

result.title: R1.1: Dictionary of load profiles: methodology and results
result.description: Public report and open data repository delivered at the end of M12 and updated, if necessary, at M24 and M36. The report will contain a description of the data sources, the data curation and anonymization process followed as well as a description of the segmentation procedure followed (using FFORMA methodology) and its results. Finally, the segmentation instrument and the resulting clusters will be included in this report. The information will be published in an open-access database to be reused by the stakeholders and the research community (including scripts). This deliverable will be peer reviewed by scientific experts.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Public Report delivered in M3 and updated in M18 and M36 This document will define how all the research data generated will be handled during the project life describing whether and how these datasets will be shared or allowed to be reused It will define the validation process of results presented in scientific publications generated by the project Also information on how all the research data and nonscientific documents generated during the lifetime of the project will be handled in terms of sharing policies data archiving and storage and preserving time

result.title: R4.2-R4.3 Final communication and dissemination report
result.description: Report delivered in M36. It will contain: a dossier of all the relevant dissemination and communication material developed, a summary of the communications and dissemination actions carried out and an assessment of the impact achieved with them. If needed, an update of the D&C strategy will be also included in Deliverable D7.3 to maximize project impact. Please note that the actions in WP6 to involve stakeholders will also report their results in this deliverable.

result.title: R2.4: WHY Plugins
result.description: Public report plus open source software implementation delivered at the end of M30. The report will contain the user manual of the different WHY plugins to integrate the WHY Toolkit with the different ESMs. A set of practical examples of how to use this integration will also be provided for use by ESMs inside and outside the WHY consortium. This deliverable will be peer reviewed by scientific and technical experts.

result.title: Results of modelling at element and building level, CIGS products
result.description: Optical, thermal, mechanical and electrical simulation reports at element level. The aim is to generate part of the information needed to show compliance with building codes and standard and extract conclusions which might lead to re-design needs. At building level, simulation of energy efficiency, lighting (for semitransparent curved CIGS elements) and all parameters determining the optimal architectural integration as a function of building typology, location, etc. The project demo buildings will also be simulated with two purposes: (1) to select the optimum implementation for the product and have a first feedback on expected performance levels and (2) to validate the software output data with the results coming from the demo installations.

result.title: Result of modeling and BIPV strategies for every demo site
result.description: The description of every pre-dimensioning will be analyzed through the BIPV modeling tool developed in WP7, with the support of TRNSys and Modelica for installations. Results will include real layouts and operation results of the new systems in the demo sites, as well as heat/cool/electricity load charts (energy demand) for a whole year of usual operation of every building.
